intro: Eumachia leptothyrsa var. multifurca, commonly known as the slender-leafed eumachia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
